description: From Middle English examinen, examenen, from Old French examiner, from Latin exāmināre.

verbs.description: examine (third-person singular simple present examines, present participle examining, simple past and past participle examined)

entries.meaning: to observe or inspect carefully or critically
examples: He examined the crime scene for clues.
She examined the hair sample under a microscope.

entries.meaning: to check the health or condition of something or someone
to determine the aptitude, skills or qualifications of someone by subjecting them to an examination

examples: The witness was examined under oath.
